title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The student’s drawing does not include exactly 14 electrons (e.g., the lone pair of electrons is omitted on the nitrogen atom). Electron pairs can be represented either by dots, or line segments.
The student’s drawing includes exactly 14 electrons, but a double bond is shown between the carbon and nitrogen atoms. Electron pairs can be represented either by dots or line segments.

The student’s drawing includes exactly 14 electrons; one pair of electrons between every two adjacent atoms plus one lone pair of electrons on the nitrogen atom. Electron pairs can be represented either by dots, or line segments. See example drawing below.
